activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A. Willis

3:00 PM Defendant Daniel A. Willis in court. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 19CF216 & 22CF110. Court states PD's office is still searching for counsel - will set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:02 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel A. Willis
Current: 1670 Circle Dr. #2, Arbor Vitae, WI 54568 United States  (Effective: 09-08-2022)
Prior: 20636 Mercer Circle, Mercer, WI 54547

No intoxicants. No taverns.  No controlled substances or non presribed drugs or over the counter of home products unless following instructions. To take any prescribed meds only as prescribed. No contact with children unless through Department of Social Services and to comply with any children's court orders.

Calling 19cf216 and 22cf110.
Court statement - PD Svehlek previously in court and  stated he was eligible for counsel, but still looking for counsel due to conflicts.
Court statement regarding bond - Defendant statement - confirms address -  Court modifies to $2000 sig bond  in each case- same conditions as originally put on.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:07  PM Defendant Daniel A. Willis appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Bail/bond hearing on August 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:39 PM Defendant Daniel A. Willis appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 19CF216 & 22CF110. Defendant statement to non-appearance. Court questions Defendant on residence/employment. Schiek statement to bond. Court questions Defendant on cases in other counties/counsel. Defendant statement to vehicle. Court statement to possible earlier court date. Court sets cash bond on both cases. adj. 01:47 PM
Status Conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
per Sam @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
per Trista @ ONSO - detainer - Vilas County

3:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel A. Willis not in court. Calling 19CF216 & 22CF110. Court states Defendant at last hearing where date for today's hearing was set. Pfeifer has not had contact - requests warrant be authorized. Court authorizes warrant in both cases. adj. 03:45 PM

3:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel A. Willis in court. Calling 19CF216 & 22CF110. Court review of case. Pfeifer states she has not had contact with Defendant. Defendant states his mother is looking for counsel that she is going to be able to fund. Defendant states he has not gone to PD's office. Bond continued. adj. 03:54 PM
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel A. Willis in court. Calling 22CF110 & 19CF216. Court review of case. Defendant states has contacted PD's office - will continue on own. Defendant waives right to counsel - waiver free and voluntary. Court directs Defendant to contact DA's office for an appointment. Pfeifer states in 19CF216 motion to rescind was granted - would like to set for sentencing - 22CF110 will be dismissed. Defendant statement to sentencing - counsel. Court states Defendant should not have children in courtroom if has care for them. Bond continued. adj. 01:27 PM
Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel A. Willis appeared by video. Calling 22CF110 & 19CF216. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states will be calling PD's office today. Court states Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 02:58 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel A. Willis appeared by video. 
Calling 22cf110 - new case and  19cf216 FTA for sentencing 5-25-2021 in br II 
In receipt of new complaint.  Right to counsel. Court questions defendant on non appearance on 19cf216.  Defendant statement. Still may seek counsel/PD on  19cf216 case as well. 
Pfeifer to bail on both cases.  Court sets $500 cash in each case.  19CF216 will be status on AIA date.  
22cf110 to be intra circuited to br II.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
